questionListItems.title: How do I find out what is the Annual Value of my Property?

answer.body:
The Annual Value (AV) of HDB properties generally falls below $21,000, while some lower-value private properties have AV between $21,000 and $25,000.

You can find out about the AV of your residence from IRAS e-Valuation List at a nominal fee. You may also check your property tax bill or log in to myTax.iras.gov.sg.

questionListItems.title: I received the Additional Premium Support application form. Who are considered as my immediate family members to be included in the application form?

answer.body: Immediate family members refer to parents, spouse and children who is/are related to the Main Applicant by blood, marriage and/or legal adoption, but does not refer to siblings.

questionListItems.title: I am planning to live overseas permanently from next year onwards. Can I apply for the suspension of MediShield Life premium collection now?

answer.body: In order to qualify for suspension of premium collection, you must have resided outside Singapore for at least five years immediately preceding your application, except for short visits back to Singapore (not exceeding 140 days in total during the five years). As such, you may wish to apply only after you have fulfilled all the criteria.

topics.title: Medishield Life Coverage For Overseas Singaporeans

questionListItems.title: Can we use Medisave to pay for IPs and riders?

answer.body:
Medisave can be used to pay for premiums of Integrated Shield Plans (IPs), subject to Additional Withdrawal Limits. All IPs are required to have co-payment features such as deductibles and co-insurance, similar to MediShield Life. The co-payment can be paid for using Medisave, up to the prevailing withdrawal limits which are set to be sufficient for subsidised care.

Co-payment is an important feature in healthcare insurance to mitigate the risk of over-consumption and over-servicing which in turn could lead to escalation in healthcare costs and insurance premiums for all Singaporeans. Hence, riders that cover co-payments fully and allow policy holders to have zero co-payments are considered as separate products from IPs and their premiums cannot be paid using Medisave.

Medisave savings are intended to be sufficient for basic healthcare needs.  We need to be careful about expanding the use of Medisave, as Singaporeans need to ensure that they have sufficient savings for healthcare expenses over their lifetime, especially after retirement. Supporting more uses will mean higher contribution rates are required.

questionListItems.title: How do I find a CHAS clinic?

answer.body:
CHAS clinics will display the CHAS sticker at their entrances.

You can also search for a CHAS clinic by using this link.

questionListItems.title: I thought the MC given is supposed to be for 5-days, why did I receive more days of MC?

answer.body: Your Doctor-In-Charge decides the MC duration as appropriate.

questionListItems.title: Am I able to self-isolate at home while waiting for my test results?

answer.body: If you are waiting for your test result, you may self-isolate and recover at home if you are medically fit and your home is deemed suitable for you to do so.

questionListItems.title: Why was the quarantine period reduced from 21 days to 14 days?

answer.body: Mpox symptoms usually start between 5 to 21 days after being infected. Isolation precautions are pre-determined at 14 days to allow PUQs to fully rest at home until symptoms (if infected) have appeared. After day 14, the PUQ will become Person-Under-Phone Surveillance (PUPS). In order to return to normalcy earlier, the additional 7-day period was implemented to ensure early detection of symptoms/complications should any appear after completion of the 14-day quarantine period.

questionListItems.title: Why are pets not allowed at my place of isolation?

answer.body: It is known that many animals including rodents may carry and transmit the mpox virus. Animal-to-human transmission may occur when an animal contracts mpox from an infected person and then spreads to other persons through bites, scratches or through direct contract with skin, mucosa, blood, and bodily fluids.

questionListItems.title: Where is the government quarantine facility located? Who is it managed by?

answer.body: Designated government quarantine facilities for persons under quarantine due to risk of mpox virus are located throughout Singapore and are managed by the Ministry of Health (MOH).

A Quarantine Order (QO) is a legal order issued under the Infectious Diseases Act 1976. It is issued to an individual who is, or is suspected to be a carrier of an infectious disease or is a contact of a person confirmed to have an infectious disease. The QO is necessary to limit the spread of the virus in the community.

questionListItems.title: What are the symptoms of mpox infection?

answer.body:
The following symptoms of mpox infection are commonly experienced at the beginning of the disease:

  • Fever

  • Rash

  • Headache

  • Muscle ache

  • Backache

  • Swollen lymph nodes

  • Chills

  • General feeling of exhaustion

  • Asthenia (profound weakness)

questionListItems.title: I am an employer. How do I know if my employees have been issued a Quarantine Order (QO)? How do I apply for the Quarantine Order Allowance (QOA)?

answer.body:
A QO Agent will get in touch with your employee if he/she has been issued a QO. Your employee should notify you that he/she has been issued a QO.

You can only apply for the QOA after your employee has completed the quarantine. Your employee under quarantine will receive the QOA form at the end of the quarantine and should pass it to you. This is to ensure that your employee has fully complied with the terms of the QO.

questionListItems.title: How long is the recovery period?

answer.body: Mpox is typically a self-limiting illness and most mpox patients usually recover within two to four weeks, although serious illness and complications may occur especially in vulnerable persons (e.g., young children, pregnant women or immunocompromised individuals).

questionListItems.title: Can vaccination protect oneself against mpox entirely?

answer.body:
The MVA-BN (JYNNEOS) vaccine is estimated to provide over 80% protection against mpox, although current data remains limited in concluding the level and duration of protection conferred by vaccination. 

Individuals are therefore advised to continue adhering to the recommended precautions against the disease, such as avoiding high-risk sexual activities and practising good personal hygiene.
